description: From wither- (“counter-”) +‎ weight. Compare Middle English witherweȝen (“to counter-weight, counter-balance”).

entries.meaning: (UK dialectal, Scotland) A counterbalancing weight; counterweight.
examples: It is good to have a speciall care that gifts come not in the ballance with grace; for that is too gross a wither-weight. Lay by the painted case when you weigh the jewell;  […]
